alert.note: Alert for Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 23 at 2:58PM EST until December 24 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas adjacent to the Pamlico Sound and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Ocracoke Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 9 AM EST Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 4 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
